columns.text: The problem will require us to compute the profit margin of Ramble On Co.

### Let's first provide the given data in the problem.

* Growth rate at 12%.
* A debt-equity ratio of 0.90.
* Dividend payout ratio of 25%.
* Assets to sales ratio of 0.85.

## Requirement.

### Compute the profit margin of Ramble On Co.
.

### Compute the retention ratio.

The problem is silent to the retained earnings and net income. To compute the retention ratio, we will derive it from the dividend payout ratio. The payout ratio is converted to the decimal value.

The formula and computation are as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Retention Ratio}&= 1 - \text{Dividend Payout Ratio}\\[15pt]

&= 1-0.25\\[15pt]

&= 0.75 \times 100 \\[15pt]

&= \boxed{\textbf{75\%}}
\end{aligned}
$$


Therefore, the retention ratio is **75%**.

### Compute the (ROE) return on equity.

The return on equity can be calculated using the derived formula from the sustainable growth rate.

The formula of the sustainable growth rate is as follows.
$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Sustainable Growth Rate}&= \text{Retention Ratio  $\times$  \text{ROE}}\\[15pt]

\end{aligned}
$$

### Derived the formula of ROE from the sustainable growth rate.

The derivation of the formula for ROE is calculated by dividing sustainable growth rate by the retention ratio.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Return on Equity}&= \dfrac{\text{Sustainable Growth Rate}}{\text{Retention Ratio}}\\[15pt]


\end{aligned}
$$

### Compute the profit margin of the company.

The profit margin calculates how many cents of profit is created for each dollar of sale.

The formula for computing the profit margin is as follows.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Profit Margin}&= \dfrac{\text{Net Income}}{\text{Sales}}\\[15pt]


\end{aligned}
$$

Net income and sales are not available in the problem; we will therefore use the available data.

### Compute the equity section of the company

The total equity is calculated by dividing 1 with one plus debt-equity ratio multiplied by assets.


The formula is as follows.
$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Equity}&= \dfrac{1}{\text{(1 + Debt-Equity Ratio $\times$) Assets}}\\[15pt]

&=\boxed{ \dfrac{1}{1.90 \times {\text{Assets}}}}\\[15pt] 

\end{aligned}
$$



Therefore, the total equity is **1/(1.90)Assets**.

### Compute the profit margin.

Now that the equity, assets, and sales are available, we can compute the profit margin.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Profit Margin}&= \dfrac{0.85(\text{Net Profit)}}{\text{1.90(Equity)}}\times \text{ROE}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{0.85}{1.90} \times \text{16\%}\\[15pt]

&= 0.4474 \times 16\%\\[15pt]

&= 0.716 \times 100\\[15pt]
&= \boxed{\textbf{7.16\%}}
\end{aligned}
$$

Therefore, the profit margin is **7.16%**.
